title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
02:04 <npm> has quit  
03:23 <chalx> has quit  
03:48 <kstuart> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:45 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
05:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning  
09:09 <vmassol> I have something strange on exo  
09:09 <vmassol> when I go to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Plugin it fails  
09:09 <vmassol> but if I go to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Application it works fine  
09:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: Hi  
09:10 <tmortagne> looking  
09:10 <Denis> has quit  
09:11 <tmortagne> not sure what this means, the display of an extension is pretty simple there should not be any advanced logic  
09:11 <tmortagne> looking at objects  
09:12 <vmassol> checking some other plugin  
09:12 <vmassol> others work so it seems it's this one speifically  
09:12 <vmassol> {{remotecode source="https://raw.github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-ratings/master/plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/ratings/RatingsPluginApi.java" /}}  
09:12 <vmassol> ?  
09:13 <tmortagne> I was thinking about that yes  
09:13 <tmortagne> I get a 404 with https://raw.github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-ratings/master/plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/ratings/RatingsPluginApi.java anyway  
09:13 <vmassol> indeed  
09:14 <vmassol> the problem is remotecode macro  
09:14 <tmortagne> still it's weird  
09:14 <vmassol> if you go to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/RemoteCodeMacro in view mode it fails  
09:14 <tmortagne> ok so it's the whole macro not much to do with the target  
09:14 <vmassol> not sure  
09:14 <vmassol> because the example on that page  
09:14 <vmassol> points to invalid urls too  
09:15 <vmassol> it seems it's xwiki.getURLContent  
09:15 <vmassol> that fails  
09:15 <vmassol> it probably doesn't have a low timeout  
09:15 <vmassol> and xwiki.org times out before (skol)  
09:15 <tmortagne> you don't get a timeout with https://raw.github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-ratings/master/plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/ratings/RatingsPluginApi.java  
09:15 <tmortagne> you get instant 404 answer  
09:15 <vmassol> hmm  
09:16 <tmortagne> but http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/tags/xwiki-web-2.0/standard/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/widgets/confirmationBox.js is a timeout I agree  
09:16 <vmassol> updating removecode macro example  
09:18 <vmassol> hmm  
09:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: the default timeout of getURLContent is 60000  
09:18 <tmortagne> or the value in xwiki.http.timeout property in xwiki.cfg  
09:19 <vmassol> I'v eupdated with a correct source  
09:19 <tmortagne> it's possible to pass a custom one as second parameter  
09:19 <vmassol> and it still fails  
09:19 <tmortagne> ok  
09:19 <vmassol> {{remotecode language="javascript" source="https://raw.github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/xwiki-web-2.0/xwiki-platform-web/standard/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/widgets/confirmationBox.js" /}}  
09:20 <tmortagne> any idea since when it's failing ?  
09:21 <vmassol> no  
09:21 <tmortagne> did you tried xwiki.getURLContent without the code macro ?  
09:22 <tmortagne> or tried with language none  
09:23 <vmassol> seems to be related to the code macro  
09:23 <vmassol> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
09:23 <vmassol> works  
09:24 <vmassol> none works too: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
09:24 <tmortagne> does not seems to work better with none on Ratings+Plugin  
09:24 <vmassol> works on http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
09:27 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have some idea  
09:29 <vmassol> hmm no  
09:29 <vmassol> works on http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
09:30 <vmassol> (I get the html of coruse but works)  
09:31 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Plugin  
09:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: does it work for you?  
09:32 <vmassol> doesn't for me  
09:32 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <tmortagne> actually it does but I'm on it too, what happen is that highlighting a java this size is very slow  
09:33 <vmassol> yes but it fails with none too  
09:33 <tmortagne> I made it work with java 1à minutes ago  
09:33 <tmortagne> 10  
09:33 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/RemoteCodeMacro is failng too  
09:33 <vmassol> even with none  
09:34 <vmassol> ah just worked  
09:34 <vmassol> after a long time  
09:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: all highlighting is synced there is only one at a time in this version  
09:34 <vmassol> ah yes indeed  
09:34 <tmortagne> if one is slow all is slow  
09:35 <vmassol> bbiab  
09:36 <tmortagne> fixed the link in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Plugin anyway  
09:37 <tmortagne> all that should be a lot better with XWIKI-8360  
09:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
09:47 <Denis> has quit  
09:57 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <Denis> mflorea: Hi, let me know when you want to talk again about the DW issues, I have more information now  
10:20 <mflorea> Hi Denis, which issues?  
10:20 <Denis> mflorea: the one we talked before, about launching two update simultaneously  
10:20 <mflorea> ok  
10:21 <mflorea> what did you discover?  
10:21 <Denis> a refresh does not help, the job has not been schedule as you were expecting  
10:22 <mflorea> you're referring to the second job right?  
10:22 <mflorea> so while one job is running, you trigger the second and it isn't scheduled  
10:23 <Denis> no, the request returns what I see, only the description / deps tabs  
10:23 <mflorea> that's the standard extension display  
10:24 <Denis> there is no error no where I could have checked  
10:24 <mflorea> but when you say the job has not been scheduled you are referring to the second job  
10:24 <Denis> neither in the browser, nor in the network exchange, or on the server  
10:24 <Denis> yes  
10:24 <mflorea> ok  
10:24 <Denis> I click update, and nothing happen, I get the standard display  
10:24 <mflorea> let me try something  
10:25 <Denis> I need to click again  
10:25 <Denis> when the first job is finished  
10:25 <mflorea> and it works the second time?  
10:25 <mflorea> ah  
10:25 <mflorea> ok  
10:28 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <evalica> has quit  
11:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <tdelafosse> has quit  
11:33 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <Denis> has quit  
12:12 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <vmassol> @manuel: you may want to remove auto watch on xwiki.org for your user, you are wathcing a lot of pages… unless you're using it  
12:30 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <msmeria> has quit  
12:32 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <sburjan`> has quit  
12:34 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
12:49 <mflorea> Denis: I think I managed to reproduce your problem (I had found another issue before, with Velocity's #parse directive which fails to register the Velocity macro from time to time, don't know why). I'm debugging.  
12:49 <Denis> mflorea: great :)  
12:59 <mflorea> has quit  
13:38 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <sburjan> vmassol: ping  
13:40 <Denis> has quit  
13:42 <vmassol> sburjan: pong  
13:48 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <sburjan> vmassol: I am trying to run the exnterprise-test-ui on localhost, but something goes wrong and I can't figure out what I am missing.  http://pastebin.com/8FSb02yk after XWiki is started, the register page has html macros error, and all tests fail. Any idea what am I missing ?  
13:52 <tmortagne> sburjan: for some reason you seems to have 2 different version of logback in your distribution  
13:53 <tmortagne> logback-classic-1.0.11.jar and logback-classic-1.0.13.jar  
13:53 <tmortagne> according to the log  
13:53 <tmortagne> and they don't plain well with each other of course  
13:53 <sburjan> ok, let me check my actual instance  
13:54 <sburjan> don't know exactly where in .m2 the xwiki package is downloaded  
13:54 <tmortagne> it's not in .m2  
13:54 <tmortagne> look at the log  
13:54 <sburjan> yes, it's in target, sorry  
13:55 <tmortagne> 14:45:35.254 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings. 14:45:35.255 [Thread-2] ERROR  o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - SLF4J: Found binding in  [jar:file:/home/sorinello/gitrepos/xwiki-enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-5.1-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/logback-classic-1.0.11.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class] 14:45:3  
13:55 <tmortagne> so /home/sorinello/gitrepos/xwiki-enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-5.1-SNAPSHOT  
13:55 <sburjan> tmortagne: I have 2 logback-core jars  
13:55 <tmortagne> you probably have two of each logback jars  
13:56 <tmortagne> I don't see how this could happen in standard XE, do you have custom build ?  
13:56 <sburjan> but this is the jetty XE build  
13:56 <sburjan> no, no custom build  
13:56 <sburjan> let me check in 5.1 M2 zip I just downloaded  
13:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: they are not duplicated in M2, but in the package the ui-tests download.. they are duplicated  
13:57 <sburjan> I'm gonna do a clean install  
13:58 <tmortagne> sburjan: if it in the downloaded war then it's not on your side  
13:58 <tmortagne> you could make sure by looking at what's on maven.xwiki.org  
14:00 <sburjan> tmortagne: no, the was seems ok. only logback-core and logback-classic.  
14:01 <sburjan> \*war  
14:01 <sburjan> so it must be something on my side  
14:01 <tmortagne> the war is rigth but the jetty/hsqldb zip is wrong ?  
14:01 <tmortagne> you said your were downloading it  
14:01 <sburjan> no, the jetty/hsqldb zip is ok also  
14:03 <sburjan> gonna look deeper  
14:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <sburjan> tmortagne: I fixed the issue, now it works ok, except when shuttnig down the wiki throws some exceptions about SOLR  
14:43 <sburjan> and .. hangs  
14:44 <sburjan> I wonder why this doesn't happend on CI  
14:47 <sburjan> no, they actually happen on CI also  
14:47 <sburjan> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/2359/console  
14:51 <tmortagne> sburjan: the errors I see in http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/2359/console don't seems to have anything to do with the shutdown  
14:51 <tmortagne> shutdown is done after all the test are executed  
14:51 <sburjan> well I only run one Test Class (Tags).. and after the 3 tests finish, wiki is shut down. But it seems wiki shutdown is blocked by SOLR thread  
14:52 <tmortagne> why do you say it's SOLR thread ?  
14:52 <tmortagne> you took a thread dump ?  
14:52 <sburjan> because I see SOLR things in the stack  
14:53 <sburjan> no, but the wiki does not shut down like it should happen when pressing ctrl+c for example  
14:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: could you past them somewhere because they are not in http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/2359/console  
14:54 <sburjan> tmortagne, : a execution of tags tests only: http://pastebin.com/pPpyTgAE  
14:55 <tmortagne> sburjan: you have lots of error in there and not only SOLR, in fact I see mostly lucene errors at the end  
14:56 <sburjan> it's the downloaded package, so it was not altered by me in any way  
14:57 <tmortagne>   most of the error I see here are cause by the cache being disposed before lucene and solr threads it seems  
14:58 <tmortagne> but it does not explain why it's blocked, you get tons on exceptions for a long time until you kill it ?  
14:58 <sburjan> no, I only get what you saw in the pastebin and t hen it just hangs .. no more stacktraces, no more nothing  
14:58 <sburjan> but it doesn't die by itself  
14:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: would be nice if you could get a thread dump when it's blocking  
14:59 <tmortagne> after a while  
14:59 <tmortagne> will be easy to see what thread are left  
14:59 <sburjan> if you tell me how to do that, i'll gladly do it  
15:00 <vmassol> lmgtfy :)  
15:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: you have lots of examples on google  
15:01 <sburjan> ok, I'll wait 10 minutes after it's stuck and do a thread dump and paste it to y ou  
15:01 <vmassol> http://bit.ly/11WunJg  
15:03 <sburjan> tmortagne: i tried again, I did not get the stacktrace from above, but still hangs after Graceful shutdown. it means there is still something back which keeps it from exiting properly. gonna wait 10 minz and follow vmassol's link :)  
15:18 <sburjan> tmortagne: it closed by itself after some time  
15:18 <tmortagne> sburjan: wait a bit less then  
15:19 <sburjan> tmortagne: it finished, but something remained in the background, ps aux |grep java revealed jetty was actually running  
15:21 <tmortagne> sburjan: you sure you don't have several ? it can't still be running if it closed AFAIK  
15:25 <sburjan> tmortagne,: http://pastebin.com/5y3UGwtD  
15:27 <tmortagne> sburjan: I think you did a thread dump of the test instance, not XE  
15:27 <tmortagne> you have 2 java running, maven and jetty  
15:28 <sburjan> tmortagne: indeed. This is the right one: http://pastebin.com/mtjKUmX5  
15:28 <sburjan> too bad I can't understand nothing from it :(  
15:30 <vmassol> sburjan: there's a solution for that too! :) http://bit.ly/11Wz8SY  
15:31 <sburjan> :D  
15:32 <tmortagne> sburjan: what jvm is that ?  
15:32 <sburjan> java version "1.6.0\_27"  
15:32 <sburjan> OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.12.5) (6b27-1.12.5-1ubuntu1)  
15:32 <sburjan> OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.0-b12, mixed mode)  
15:32 <tmortagne> it looks like Thread.join() is blocking for you for a dead thread  
15:32 <sburjan> also, surefire-tests jvm process ended  
15:32 <sburjan> but jetty is still running as a process  
15:33 <tmortagne> could you test with Oracle JVM ?  
15:33 <sburjan> I could install it, yes, and switch to it  
15:34 <sburjan> Oracle 6 right ?  
15:34 <tmortagne> yes  
15:34 <sburjan> ok, trying  
15:34 <tmortagne> on my side I'm trying to reproduce the same situation  
15:34 <sburjan> do you need another dump now  after surefire-tests java process has ended ? now my only java process running in the system is jetty  
15:34 <sburjan> or can I kill it and install Oracle  
15:35 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can kill it  
15:38 <sburjan> tmortagne, : isn't the Java package in Universe in Ubuntu ?  
15:38 <tmortagne> sburjan: no  
15:39 <tmortagne> https://launchpad.net/~webupd8team/+archive/java  
15:39 <tmortagne> use that ppa  
15:39 <sburjan> thanks  
15:49 <sburjan> tmortagne: do I have to reboot my machine after setting Oracle from sudo update-alternatives --config java ?  
15:49 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can chech that easily with java --version  
15:54 <sburjan> tmortagne: same on oracle JVM: http://pastebin.com/u4i7V9E1  
15:55 <sburjan> JVM version  
15:55 <sburjan> java version "1.6.0\_45"  
15:55 <sburjan> Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.45-b01, mixed mode)  
15:56 <tmortagne> will try to reproduce but jenkisn never have the issue and I never saw it myself  
15:56 <sburjan> try to only run \_one\_ TestClass.. I am doing it with Tags  
16:14 <chalx> has quit  
16:20 <tmortagne> sburjan: I reproduced some kind of block, need to reproduce it in debug mode now  
16:29 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <vmassol> msmeria: i that a correct page: http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReportingExecutions/Web+Tests.Compare+Two+Minor+Versions5 ?  
16:29 <vmassol> (btw this page has no parent)  
16:30 <vmassol> sburjan: on http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome why can't I filter on "Latest product version tested"?  
16:31 <msmeria> vmassol: I don't know. as far as I see all the text executions pages look like that  
16:31 <sburjan> vmassol: that page shows \_all\_ the tests and a short summaty of the latest tested xwiki version. It is a summary page  
16:32 <vmassol> msmeria: you've really executed 229 tests manually one by one for 5.1M2 as reported by http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/XWiki+5.1+M2 ?  
16:32 <msmeria> yes, I did  
16:33 <vmassol> ok cool  
16:33 <sburjan> vmassol: the page you said to msmeria about is generated by the application, that's not for the users. Execution objects are stored on those pages. I'll write a script to add a parent for them  
16:33 <sburjan> that my fault here  
16:33 <chalx> has quit  
16:36 <vmassol> sburjan: how cna I check on the home page all tests that failed?  
16:37 <vmassol> not useful?  
16:37 <vmassol> I can see them for  given version though  
16:37 <sburjan> vmassol: you can't see this directly form the homepage. you have to go to a product page, like http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/XWiki+5.1+M2  
16:38 <sburjan> yes  
16:38 <vmassol> msmeria, sburjan: shouldn't you always start by testing on IE?  
16:38 <vmassol> chrome is one of the browser we test the most, with FF  
16:38 <vmassol> but IE is very little testedby the dev team  
16:38 <vmassol> so for me it would make sense to test on IE first  
16:38 <vmassol> (since we support ot)  
16:38 <vmassol> \*it  
16:38 <sburjan> basically the QA.WebHome and webhome of the tests spaces (taxonomy) like WebTests.WebHome are only for brief info  
16:38 <vmassol> same for the DB  
16:38 <vmassol> HSQLDB is not really needed  
16:38 <vmassol> devs use it a lot and our ci too  
16:39 <vmassol> so you should test less tested DBs  
16:39 <vmassol> like oracle or postgres  
16:40 <msmeria> vmassol: ok. I can finish the rest of the tests on ie9 and oracle. is that ok ?  
16:40 <sburjan> vmassol: so from what I see now you have a better visibility :)  
16:40 <vmassol> yep  
16:40 <vmassol> :)  
16:40 <vmassol> do you agree sburjan/msmeria about this?  
16:41 <vmassol> msmeria: yes that would make sense to me  
16:41 <sburjan> vmassol: yes. I am using postgres as default database on all my tests, I fell in love with postgres :)  
16:41 <msmeria> vmassol: I agree. I'll get to work then...  
16:41 <vmassol> cool  
16:42 <vmassol> I'm not saying to never test chrome, I'm just saying to start with supported but less tested environments in an effort to catch more issues ;)  
16:42 <vmassol> (you can ofc test with all combinations if you wish ;))  
16:46 <msmeria> vmassol: it's not if I wish it or not...it's that I don't have time for each combination and I have to choose just one for a full test  
16:47 <vmassol> I know this is why I' m proposing this  
16:47 <vmassol> :)  
16:47 <vmassol> but  
16:47 <vmassol> IMO it's a bad idea  
16:47 <vmassol> to do a full test only on one  
16:47 <vmassol> the goal is to try to catch the max # of bugs  
16:47 <vmassol> so combining environments is a better bet to catch issues I think  
16:48 <msmeria> then I have to focus on IEs. I've rarely caught bugs on FF/Chrome that weren't reproduced on IEs  
16:48 <vmassol> for ex, doing all blog tests on env1 and then doing all admin tests on env2, etc  
16:48 <vmassol> yep  
16:48 <vmassol> IE seems a good bet for the browser part  
16:49 <msmeria> and for dbs I can work with Oracle and MySQL  
16:50 <vmassol> ok  
16:56 <msmeria> has quit  
16:57 <sburjan> has quit  
17:05 <tdelafosse> has quit  
17:06 <mflorea> Denis1: I made this change https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ae4dc8ec7117a4840bf35ec3cd911e25cfd05073 . Would be great if you could check if it fixes you problem.  
17:09 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
17:09 <Denis> mflorea: I let you know as soon as I have been able to check it, but this will be probably with the next release  
17:15 <mflorea> Denis: ok  
17:26 <evalica> has quit  
18:16 <vmassol> gtg be back in 1 hour  
18:21 <tmortagne> sburjan`: you should not be blocked anymore, not because of Solr anyway  
18:21 <sburjan`> tmortagne: cool, I'll take a look tomorrow  
18:21 <sburjan`> you mean about the shutdown issue ?
